resource.chars:
(10) 

In <u>February<\u> the Winds frequented the same 
Points as in Jan: but they lay more between y<sup>e<\sup> 
N. & E. than then; & they were very boiste-
rous oftentimes. In this Month Snow was 
frequent, & now & then Thunder, & but little 
Fair weather. 
In <u>March<\u> the Winds were very Vari-
able, & sometimes strong. The Weather more 
Serene than before, w<sup>th<\sup> sometimes Snow: & 
toward the latter end, Rain, & now & then 
a Frost. 
In <u>April<\u>  the Winds were more N<sup>ly<\sup> and 
E<sup>ly<\sup> than in March, & not very strong. The 
greatest part of the Month was Freezing, & 
Fair, with some days of Rain, w<sup>th<\sup> Thunder. 
The beginning of <u>May<\u> to the 16<sup>th<\sup>, the 
Mornings were frosty, w<sup>th<\sup> some Rain, some 
Snow, & some Fair the rest of the day. After 
the 16<sup>th<\sup>, some Rain, & some Snow; & towards 
the end of the Month, Fairer. The Winds 
were variable, brisk, & about the 23, 24<sup>th<\sup>, & 
25<sup>th<\sup>, Stormy. 
In <u>June<\u> the Winds variable, pretty 
brisk
